alert.note: Alert for Elbert, Central and East Douglas Counties Above 6000 Feet; North and Northeast Elbert County Below 6000 Feet, North Lincoln County; Washington County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 27 at 6:44PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central Elbert, southern Washington and northeastern Lincoln Counties through 745 PM MDT... At 642 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line along a line extending from 11 miles south of Akron to 14 miles north of Limon to 31 miles northeast of Colorado Springs. Movement was east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph, locally heavy rainfall, and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Limon, Elbert, Kiowa, Simla, Arriba, Genoa, Thurman, Arickaree School, Cope, Anton, Elba, Matheson, Agate, and Lindon. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Elbert, Central and East Douglas Counties Above 6000 Feet; North and Northeast Elbert County Below 6000 Feet, North Lincoln County; Washington County
